segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring over the sink, creating a big puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, but she doesn't even seem to notice, she's just drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that, it must be a while.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies without her knowing, but they seem happy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman doesn't slip on the wet floor, that would be terrible and I would feel awful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching to reach that cookie jar, he must really want a cookie badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this, it's like she's in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks like she's waiting for her turn to get a cookie, she's being so patient and quiet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool might tip over any second now, that would be a disaster and I would hate to see that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just so full of little disasters waiting to happen, it's like a sad accident waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR
